3.heading: Ri, G.--Miscellanea.
3.title: "Les Travaux d'Hercule"
3.author: Michel Thiébaut
3.appears_in: p. 68-74 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 3 (Jan. 1998).
notes: Begins: "Il est des enfants prodiges, et, à n'en pas douter, Gustave Doré est de ceux-là, lui que Nadar désignera plus tard comme 'enfant du miracle.' Depuis son plus jeune âge, le jeune Gustave dessine et la précocité de son talent subjugue sa mère. C'est elle, semble-t-il, qui le présenta à l'éditeur de caricatures Philipon pour lequel il réalisa, à quize ans, sa première oeuvre imprimée, une bande dessinée intitulée Les Travaux d'Hercule."

English summary (from p. 139): "Hercules' Labours. Gustave Doré published this parodic version of the celebrated mythical hero's adventures at the age of 15. Michel Thiébaut analyses the young artist's style and his narrative methods. He also evokes later comics on the same theme: those of G. Ri, Vandersteen and Pierre Nicolas."

4.heading: Riain, Flann.
4.title: Lazy Way to Gaelic

130.heading: Ribera, Julio, 1927-
130.title: "What is Reality, Papa?"
130.author: by Ribera and Godard
130.appears_in: p. 38-46 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 9 (Dec. 1980).

131.heading: Ribera, Julio, 1927-
131.title: "What is Reality, Papa?"
131.author: by Ribera and Godard
131.appears_in: p. 35-45 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 10 (Jan. 1981).
notes: "Last month, smitten with the thought of Chimeer, Axle traveled uncharted planets, seeking her company. He met Rita, an intergalactic soothsayer, who encouraged him to go find his love, and gave him a magic caterpillar to aid him in his search. Meanwhile at Univers-all Studios in Hollywood, a starlet plays the part of Chimeer, which becomes much more than just another role."

132.heading: Ribera, Julio, 1927-
132.title: "What is Reality, Papa?"
132.author: by Godard and Ribera
132.appears_in: p. 13-23 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 11 (Feb. 1981).
notes: "As we saw last month, during the production of various films at Univers-all Studios, the actors began to take their roles just a bit to seriously. A film on the Third Reich produced actual Hitler and Goering clones, and the Boston Strangler terrorized women once again. Axle and Musky land smack-dab in the middle of all this craziness just in time to find Stuart running from a pack of wild Indians."

133.heading: Ribera, Julio, 1927-
133.title: "What is Reality, Papa?"
133.author: by Ribera and Godard
133.appears_in: p. 18-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 12 (Mar. 1981).
notes: "Hollywood was all aflutter, last we saw. The townspeople were panicked at the recent trend in which actors throughout Univers-all were taking their roles all too seriously. Stuart, the troubled studio head, was attacked and slain by a crazed motorcycle clan; Chimeer was kidnapped by two SS Men, and Axle is believed to be the pope's envoy."

134.heading: Ribera, Julio, 1927-

154.heading: Ribeyre, Félix, 1831-
154.title: Cham : sa Vie et son Oeuvre
154.author: par Félix Ribeyre ; préface par Alexandre Dumas fils.

155.heading: Ribic, Esad.
155.title: Deathlok Nation
155.author: writer, Rick Remender ; artists, Rafael Albuquerque, Esad Ribic ; color art, Dean White, Matthew Wilson ; letterer, Cory Petit.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Uncanny X-force #5-7 and #5.1, and X-Men Spotlight."
Summary (from SkyRiver): X-Force, made up of Wolverine, Archangel, Deadpool, and Psylock, together with Fantomex, hunt down Apocalypse and his Horsemen.

157.heading: Ribic, Esad.
157.title: Tomorrow Dies Today
157.author: Jason Aaron ; illustrated by Ron Garney, Esad Ribic.
notes: "Contains material originally in magazine form as Wolverine Weapon X #11-16 and Dark Reign the list."

Summary (from amazon.com via SkyRiver): "It's the debut of an all-new, all-different Deathlok. Killer cyborgs have come from the future to kill the heroes of today, while Wolverine embarks on an international pub crawl with a certain recently reborn Sentinel of Liberty. Beer and bullets galore!"

158.heading: Ribic, Esad.
158.title: Ultimate X-Men : World Tour
158.author: writer, Mark Millar, Chuck Austen ; pencils, Adam Kubert, Chris Bachalo, Esad Ribic, ; inks, Livesay, Danny Miki, Chris Bachalo.
notes: Contains material originally published in magazine form as Ultimate X-Men #13-20.
Summary (from SkyRiver): The X-Men go on a world tour in order to promote love and peace, but Professor X has a dark secret which returns to haunt them.

169.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
169.title: Akazukin Chacha
169.author: Ayahana Min.
notes: Summary (from Wikipedia 9/26/12): "The series follows the adventures of a fumbling student magician named Chacha, who habitually wears a red hooded cloak, as she seeks the truth about her family and defend the kingdom against its enemies."

170.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
170.title: Ano Ko to Isshô
170.author: Fujisue Sakura.
notes: Summary (by Christy Dietrick): Kanori makes a new friend, Kazumi, on her first day at a new school, and she decides to participate in a group date with her new best friend. Each leaves the place with a partner, but while Kazumi is head over heels in love with her new boyfriend, Kanori is not feeling anything as special.

174.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
174.title: Gakuen Ren'ai Mono
174.author: Kurihara Mamoru.
notes: Summary (by Cassandra Clay): This story follows a young girl, Misato, who goes to a school called Clara Academy, where romance is strictly forbidden. The heroine soon falls in love, but will this love be worth the risk? The main character is cute and spunky. She is not overly shy, but rather a go-getter type of person.

179.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
179.title: Himechan no Ribon
179.author: Mizusawa Megumi.
notes: Title may also be transliterated: Hime-chan no Ribon.

182.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
182.title: Kagen no Tsuki
182.author: Yazawa Ai.
notes: Summary (by Yui Totsuka): High school student Mizuki meets a man by the name of Adam and soon falls in love with him. She decides to follow him, but gets hit by a car when her ex-boyfriend calls to her. Later a girl named Hotaru follows a cat into an abandoned home, where she finds the girl that she has been seeing in her dreams, Mizuki. Hotaru then finds out that she is the only one that can see Mizuki, and that Mizuki has lost her memory. Hotaru and her friends decide to call her Eve and go on to find out who she is and why she is trapped in the abandoned home.

189.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
189.title: Marin Burû no Kaze ni Dakarete
189.author: Yazawa Ai.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Haruka meets her first love, Tôru, again when he comes back from America. Although they are in love with each other, they hold back their feelings because they care too much for others who complicate their relationship. A bittersweet story of the teenagers with aching hearts between love and friendship.

191.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
191.title: Nana
191.author: Yazawa Ai.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Two eighteen year old girls, both named Nana, meet on train. Nana Osaki is a punk-rock singer and Nana Komatsu, also known as Hachi, comes from a small town and is on her way to Tokyo to start a new life. They become close friends, but must go their own way in pursuit of love and happiness.

194.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
194.title: Tokimeki Tunaito
194.author: Ikeno Koi.
notes: Summary (from Ohio State via SkyRiver): A story about the daughter of a vampire and a werewolf woman who falls in love with her classmate.

195.heading: Ribon Mascot Comics.
195.title: Tokimeki Tunaito : Hoshi no Yukue
195.author: Ikeno Koi
notes: A collection of stories which precede and follow the stories in the author's Tokimeki Tunaito.

197.heading: Ribon no Kishi. English.
197.title: Princess Knight
197.author: Osamu Tezuka ; translation, Maya Rosewood.
notes: "Originally serialized in Japanese as Ribon no Kishi in Shoujo Kuraba, Kodansha, 1953-56; reworked and serialized anew in Nakayoshi, Kodansha, 1963-66. ; This translation based on the Tezuka Osamu Manga Zenshu edition, Kodansha, 1977.".

Summary (from SkyRiver): In order to inherit her kingdom, Princess Sapphire is raised as a prince, and must fend off usurpers to the crown, evil witches, and jealous goddesses to secure her throne and find her own handsome prince.

198.heading: Ribon no Kishi--Miscellanea.

203.heading: Ribon no Kishi--Miscellanea.
203.title: Manga! Manga! : The World of Japanese Comics
203.author: Frederik L. Schodt. Updated pbk. ed.

206.heading: Riboryûshon 199X.
206.title: Gurashêru no Kagi = Key of Graciale
206.author: Manabe Jôji.

207.heading: Ribosu. English.
207.title: Rebirth
207.author: story and art by Woo ; translator, Lauren Na.
notes: First published in Korea in 1998 by Daiwon C.I. Inc.
The author, known in English as Woo or Kang-Woo Lee, is entered by the library establishment at Yi, Kang-u.

"An experiment in synthesis: An eastern golem made by Buddhist monks, Beryun is a living Yin Yang symbol, a perfect synthesis of Light and Dark magic. She is a creature of opposites. Beautiful, yet deadly

spiritual, yet soulless. The vampire Deshwitat came to China to visit her creators in the hope that they could teach him Light Magic. A wandering swordsman who cannot die: Three hundred years ago, Rett Buttler was one of Deshwitat's only friends. After the Light Sorcerer Kalutika imprisoned Deshwitat, Rett fought to avenge his friend and would have died, had his opponent not had other plans. Kalutika cursed Rett with immortality

dooming him to witness the Apocalypse that the sorceror would bring forth. An unexpected savior: Deshwitat began his journey seeking only revenge, but now he has the weight of the world on his shoulders. His enemy, Kalutika, is prophesized "to bring about the end of the world," and Deshwitat must master Light Magic in order to stop him. When Eastern monks fail Deshwitat, only one option remains
he must travel west to the very source of Light Magic..The Vatican"

208.heading: Ribot, Catherine.
208.title: Droit et BD : l'Univers Juridique et Politique de la Bande Dessinée

219.heading: Ribula, Torpedo.
219.title: "The Coming of Oran"
219.author: art: Edd Ashe? 4 p

contents.author: Jean David Morvan, writer
contents.title: Rib'Wund. Artifice. Maximum (In)security

notes: Introduction and origin of Oran; introduction of Zack Temson, Oran's father; villains introduced are Faro Farly and Torpedo Ribula.
Data from Gene Reed via Grand Comic Book Database.
Original titles: Sillage 6: Artifices, and Sillage 7: Q H I.

"In Artifice, feisty human agent Navee falls on a planet persecuted by a ruling class with little regard for life. She faces her coldest rival ever. In Maximum (In)security, she is given the task of dismantling a ring trafficking in planets but to do so she must retrieve Rib'Wund, a mercenary she worked with already, out of a maximum security prison filled with ultra violent inmates. We also get to find out how she got those white bands across her body."
